F1.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata are assigned a globally unique and persistent identifier.

F1Q1.question: Does an ontology have a “local” identifier i.e., a globally unique and potentially persistent identifier assigned by the developer (or developing organization)?

F1Q2.question: Does an ontology provide an additional “external” identifier i.e., a guarantee globally unique and persistent identifier assigned by an accredited body?

F1Q3.question: If yes, is this external identifier a DOI?

F1Q4.question: Are the ontology metadata included in the ontology file –and consequently share the same identifiers?

F1Q5.question: If not, is the metadata record clearly identified by its own GUPRI?

F1Q6.question: Does an ontology provide a version specific URI?

F1Q7.question: If yes, is this URI resolvable/dereferenceable?

F2.label: Ontologies are described with rich ontology metadata

F2Q1.question: Is an ontology described with additional “MIRO must” metadata properties? (4 points per property up to 16 credits)

F2Q2.question: Is an ontology described with additional “MIRO should” metadata properties? (2 points per property up to 5 credits)

F2Q3.question: Is an ontology described with additional “MIRO optional” metadata properties? (1 point per property up to 3 credits)

F2Q4.question: Is an ontology described with another metadata property with no explicit corresponding MIRO requirement?  (1 pt per property up to 3 credits)

F3.label: Ontology metadata clearly and explicitly includes the identifier of the ontologies they describe.

F3Q1.question: Are the ontology metadata included and maintained in the ontology file?

F3Q2.question: If not, are the ontology metadata described in an external file?

F3Q3.question: Does that external file explicitly link to the ontology and vice-versa?

F4.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata are registered or indexed in a searchable resource typically an ontology repository.

F4Q1.question: Is the ontology registered in multiple ontology libraries? (1 point per ontology library)

F4Q2.question: Is the ontology registered in multiple open ontology repositories? (1 point per ontology repository up to credits)

F4Q3.question: Is an ontology registered in the "de facto" reference libraries or repositories? (1 point per a "de facto" refernce library up to 4 credits)

F4Q4.question: Are the ontology libraries or repositories properly indexed by Web search engines?

A1.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata are retrievable by their identifier using a standardized communication protocol.

A1Q1.question: Does the ontology URI and other identifiers, if exist, resolve to the ontology? (3 points per a resolvable identifier up to 6 credits)

A1Q2.question: Does the ontology URI (if metadata is included in the ontology file) or the external metadata URI resolve to the metadata record ?

A1Q3.question: Are ontology and its metadata supporting content negociation ? (6 points per format up to 24 credits)

A1Q4.question: Is an ontology and its metadata accessible through another standard protocol such as SPARQL?

A11.label: The protocol to retrieve ontologies and ontology metadata is open, free and universally implementable.

A11Q1.question: Is an ontology relying on HTTP/URIs for its identification and access mechanisms ?

A11Q2.question: Are the other protocols –if any– open, free, and universally implementable ?

A12.label: The protocol to retrieve ontologies and ontology metadata support authentification and authorization when an ontology has access restriction.

A12Q1.question: Does the protocols used to resolve ontology identifiers support authentication and authorization ?

A12Q2.question:
Is the ontology accessible in an ontology repository or library that supports authentication 
and authorization (such as NCBO BioPortal, AgroPortal)?  (3 points per an ontology repository up to 18 cerdits)

A2.label: Ontology metadata should be accessible even when the ontology is no longer available.

A2Q2.question: Are the metadata of each version available?

A2Q3.question: Are ontology metadata accessible even if no more versions of the ontology are available ?

A2Q4.question: Is the ontology accessible in an ontology repository or library that supports metadata archiving ?

A2Q5.question: Is the status of the ontology clearly informed ?

I1.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata use a formal, accessible, shared and broadly  applicable language for knowledge representation.

I1Q1.question:
What is the representation language used for ontology and ontology metadata? (If the ontology is in an OWL format else follow our representation format scoring scale*)
 (*) Scoring scale of each representation format: (OWL, 20 pts)- (SKOS, 18 pts)- (RDFS, 16 pts)- (OBO, 14 pts)- (XML, 12 pts)- (CSV, 11 pts)- (PDF, 5 pts)- (TXT, 5 pts).

I1Q2.question: Is the representation language used a W3C Recommendations ?

I1Q3.question: Is the syntax of the ontology informed ?

I1Q4.question: Is the formality level of the ontology asserted by the author ?

I1Q5.question: Is the availability of other formats informed ?

I2.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata use vocabularies that follow FAIR principles.

I2Q1.question: Does the ontology import other FAIR vocabularies ?

I2Q2.question: Does the ontology reuse URIs from other vocabularies ?

I2Q3.question: If yes, does it include the minimum information for those URIs (cf. MERIOT) ?

I2Q4.question: Is an ontology aligned to other vocabularies ?

I2Q5.question: If yes, are those alignments well represented and to unambiguous entities ?

I2Q6.question: If yes, are those alignments curated ?

I2Q7.question: Does an ontology provide metadata information about relation to or influence of other vocabularies? (1 point per metadata property up to 3 credits)

I2Q8.question: Does the ontology reuse standards metadata vocabularies to describe its metadata ?

I3.label: Ontologies or ontology metadata include qualified references to other (meta)data.

I3Q2.question: Does an ontology provide cross-references to external resources ?

I3Q3.question: If yes, are those cross-references well represented and to unambiguous entities?

I3Q4.question: Does an ontology provide information about projects using or organization endorsing?  (3 points per a property up to 6 credits)

I3Q5.question: Is an ontology using GUPRIs to encode some metadata values?

R1.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata are richly described with a plurality of accurate and relevant attributes.

R1Q1.question: Does the ontology provide metadata information about how classes are defined?

R1Q2.question: Does the ontology provide metadata information about its hierarchy?

R1Q3.question: How much of the ontology classes (or concepts) are defined using a proprty restriction (e.g. OWL quantifier, cardinality or has value restrictions) or an equivalent class (e.g. an OWL named class)?

R1Q4.question: How much of the ontology objects provide provenance information with annotation properties (e.g., author, date)?

R11.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata are released with a clear and accessible  usage license.

R11Q1.question: Is the ontology license clearly specified (i.e., with a persistent, unique identifier)?

R11Q2.question: If yes, is the license description accessible and resolvable by a machine?

R11Q3.question: Are the ontology access rights clearly specified/declared?

R11Q4.question: Are the permissions, usage guidelines and copyright holder clearly documented?

R12.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata are associated with detailed provenance.

R12Q1.question: Does an ontology metadata inform on its general provenance (e.g., source, creator, validator)?

R12Q2.question: Are the accrual methods and policy documented?

R12Q4.question: Are the methodology and tools used to build the ontology documented?

R12Q6.question: Does an ontology inform on its funding organization?

R13.label: Ontologies and ontology metadata meet domain-relevant community standards.

R13Q1.question: Is the ontology included in the OBO library?

R13Q2.question: If yes, is the ontology part of the main OBO foundry ontologies?

R13Q3.question: Is the ontology included in the WHEAT group ?

R13Q4.question: Is the ontology included in the the CROP ontology project?

R13Q5.question: Is the ontology included in the INRAE group ?

R13Q6.question: Is the ontology openly and freely available ?
